se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.analyzer

Class AbstractPomAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.analyzer.AbstractPomAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PomAnalyzer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PatternPomAnalyzer

    public abstract class AbstractPomAnalyzer
extends Object
implements PomAnalyzer
    Abstract PomAnalyzer implementation, providing convenience methods for validating various properties of Maven POMs. Override this for a concrete PomAnalyzer class which can be applied along with a concrete NamingStrategy to analyze and validate the content of POMs for compliance with a given strategy.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractPomAnalyzer(NamingStrategy namingStrategy)
      Creates an AbstractPomAnalyzer using the supplied NamingStrategy to create Names from Models and to validate the well-formedness of POMs.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • validateRootReactorPom

        public final void validateRootReactorPom(org.apache.maven.model.Model aRootReactorPom)
                                  throws InvalidStructureException
        Validates the supplied Maven Root reactor POM Model or throws an exception indicating why the supplied POM was invalid. The "Root reactor POM" is the topmost POM within the local reactor, not counting a Parent POM which is not built within the reactor. This method is a convenience specification, and should yield the equivalent of calling validate(aRootReactorPom, PomAnalyzer.PomType.ROOT_REACTOR, null)
        Specified by:
        validateRootReactorPom in interface PomAnalyzer
        Parameters:
        aRootReactorPom - A non-null maven Model from the topmost POM within the reactor (a.k.a. root reactor POM).
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied aRootReactorPom had invalid dependencies according to this PomAnalyzer.

      • validateTopmostParentPom

        public final void validateTopmostParentPom(org.apache.maven.model.Model topmostParentPom)
                                    throws InvalidStructureException
        Validates the supplied Maven topmost parent POM Model or throws an exception indicating why the supplied POM was invalid. The "topmost parent POM" is the topmost POM within the local reactor, used as Parent for other POMs. This differs from the root reactor pom in that parent poms are used to define dependencies and plugins but not modules. This method is a convenience specification, and should yield the equivalent of calling validate(topmostParentPom, PomAnalyzer.PomType.PARENT, null)
        Specified by:
        validateTopmostParentPom in interface PomAnalyzer
        Parameters:
        topmostParentPom - A non-null maven Model from the topmost parent POM within the reactor.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied aRootReactorPom had invalid dependencies according to this PomAnalyzer.

      • validate

        public final void validate(org.apache.maven.model.Model aPOM,
                           PomType expectedType,
                           org.apache.maven.model.Model parentOrNull)
                    throws InvalidStructureException
        Validates the supplied Maven POM Model or throws an exception indicating why the supplied POM was invalid.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface PomAnalyzer
        Parameters:
        aPOM - The POM model to validate.
        expectedType - The expected type of POM to validate the supplied Model against.
        parentOrNull - The expected parent of aPOM, or null if it is irrelevant.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied aPOM was invalid according to this PomDependencyStrategy.

      • validateParentPom

        protected void validateParentPom(org.apache.maven.model.Model toValidate,
                                 PomType expectedType,
                                 org.apache.maven.model.Model parentOrNull)
                          throws InvalidStructureException
        Verifies that the supplied toValidate Model does not contain any defined Modules, and that the supplied nonNullParent has the same GAV coordinates as the supplied toValidate POM.
        Parameters:
        toValidate - The POM model to validate.
        expectedType - The expected type of POM to validate the supplied Model against.
        parentOrNull - A Model which holds the expected Maven GAV coordinates for the aPOM's Parent POM.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the Model does not conform to structure specifications.

      • validateReactorPom

        protected void validateReactorPom(org.apache.maven.model.Model toValidate,
                                  org.apache.maven.model.Model nonNullParent)
                           throws InvalidStructureException
        Verifies that the supplied toValidate Model does not contain any defined Modules, and that the supplied nonNullParent has the same GAV coordinates as the supplied toValidate POM.
        Parameters:
        toValidate - The POM model to validate.
        nonNullParent - A Model which holds the expected Maven GAV coordinates for the aPOM's Parent POM.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the Model does not conform to structure specifications, i.e. if the reactor POM was invalid.

      • performCustomRootReactorPomValidation

        protected void performCustomRootReactorPomValidation(org.apache.maven.model.Model rootReactorModel)
                                              throws InvalidStructureException
        Override this method to perform custom validation of the Maven Model from the root reactor POM. The NamingStrategy has already been used to validate maven GAV coordinates for the supplied root reactor when this method is invoked.
        Parameters:
        rootReactorModel - the root rootReactorModel which should be validated in a custom way.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied aRootReactorModel was invalid.

      • performCustomTopmostParentPomValidation

        protected void performCustomTopmostParentPomValidation(org.apache.maven.model.Model topmostParentModel)
                                                throws InvalidStructureException
        Override this method to perform custom validation of the Maven Model from the topmost parent POM. The NamingStrategy has already been used to validate maven GAV coordinates for the supplied topmost parent POM when this method is invoked.
        Parameters:
        topmostParentModel - the root rootReactorModel which should be validated in a custom way.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied topmostParentModel was invalid.

      • verifyParentPom

        protected final void verifyParentPom(org.apache.maven.model.Model toVerify,
                                     org.apache.maven.model.Model requiredParent)
                              throws InvalidStructureException
        Verifies that the supplied toValidate Model has identical groupId, artifactId and version of the supplied requiredParent Model.
        Parameters:
        toVerify - The Model to verify.
        requiredParent - The Maven Model containing data of the required Parent for the supplied toVerify Model.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the GAV coordinates of the supplied toVerify Model did not match those of the supplied requiredParent Module.

      • verifyNoModules

        protected void verifyNoModules(org.apache.maven.model.Model toVerify)
                        throws InvalidStructureException
        Verifies that the supplied Model does not have any defined Modules. This is a requirement for all Parent POMs, since they should be the direct parents of artifact/leaf projects within a multi-module reactor.
        Parameters:
        toVerify - The Model to verify.
        Throws:
        InvalidStructureException - if the supplied Model contained Module definitions.

      • getExpectedArtifactIdSuffix

        protected String getExpectedArtifactIdSuffix(PomType type)
        Retrieves the expected suffix for an artifactID of a project Model with the supplied type.
        Parameters:
        type - The PomType of a project.
        Returns:
        the expected suffix for an artifactID of a project Model with the supplied type, or null if none could be provided. (This is the case for a OTHER_PARENT only).
